stream_context.summary: Kaze prototypes the Course 11 "Bowser construction site" content: finishes a chain-reaction Womp-tower gag, adds an angry Koopa cement-pit NPC, discusses hint design and ROM-size optimisation, and coordinates animations, music and testing.

development_findings.summary: Built a stack of idle Womps arranged like bricks; kicking one triggers a chain-reaction animation, particles and screams, topples the tower and counts toward a star.
development_findings.quote: This tower is tiny and what the hell... Alright, that’s our Womp tower. Next to make it so that if you kick one of them over they're all gonna make a chain reaction.

development_findings.summary: Each Womp now displays rude dialogue hinting at its purpose ("Back off, pipsqueak. No cutting the line – it’s almost my turn to be made into a building"). This replaces intrusive exclamation-mark ideas and supports the ‘show-don’t-tell’ philosophy.
Implemented Koopa cement-pit NPC with idle, talking and angry animations. Stepping in fresh cement leaves footprints, triggers Koopa rotation, angry text and sound effects.
development_findings.quote: You ruined it! – He’s so angry. He should just start attacking you.

development_findings.summary: Defined the full prank list for Star 1: Womp tower, Koopa cement pit, Goomba lunch break beam, glass-carrying Koopas, and an oil-barrel slide; still needs Wiggler overseer hints and oil interaction coding.
Adjusted lighting system: camera now acts as light source and added brightness modifier; previous builds were "way too dark".
Began aggressive ROM-size cuts: removed unused SM64 backgrounds and identified 44 kHz samples to down-sample, expecting ~0.5 MB gain to reserve space for streamed WAV/MP3 tracks.
development_findings.quote: We’re at a point where we have to optimise the game for ROM size… We’re gonna save like half a megabyte of ROM size, which is very good.

development_findings.summary: Debugged an N64-only crash in the background-shaping function (floating-point exception tied to colour table offsets); deferred final fix.
Confirmed new level is less CPU expensive; performed real-hardware FPS test though crash occurred; anticipates acceptable performance once fixed.
Explained layered-hint design: avoid single exclamation marks, rely on multiple subtle clues plus optional overseer dialogue to lift player success rate from ~60 % to 90 %.
development_findings.quote: You can never truly get everyone to 100 %, so you add more and more failsafe mechanics.

development_findings.summary: Removed / shortened an unused platform-and-crane stretch to cut triangles and simplify flow.
Placeholder AI-generated lo-fi music will be replaced; composer Badub is back, has tried ten drafts for this level’s track.
development_findings.quote: Dude, Badub finally wrote me again today… He said he’s been working on it for a week and he just can’t figure out how to make it good.

development_findings.summary: Considering multiplayer with selectable characters (Mario, Luigi, maybe Yoshi); hesitant because every costume would need dialogue and costume variants.

context_findings.summary: Kaze moved streams to YouTube because Twitch ads were unbearable.
context_findings.quote: I couldn’t stand Twitch anymore because of all the ads.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: difficulty should emerge from ‘cool platforming’; prefers ‘show-don’t-tell’ with multiple subtle hints.
context_findings.quote: Difficulty in a game is not a thing you should strive for; instead you should strive for having cool platforming.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: local severe rainstorms caused flooding; mentioned during stream.
Expressed pride in micro-optimising N64 code and playful rivalry with other modders.
context_findings.quote: KhakiDev is just salty that I changed his code to be a bit faster on the N64.

context_findings.summary: Brief reflection on politics and public persona: doesn’t want to hide views but also finds total silence ‘psychopathic’.

badub.summary: Returned to project after absence; working on Course 11 track, already produced ten iterations but not satisfied yet.
badub.quote: He’s back and he’s making music again… He said he’s been working on it for a week and he just can’t figure out how to make it good.

zeina.summary: Provided new Koopa animations (idle, talking, angry) and Womp fall animations; also produced humorous ‘banana cat’ model during stream.

key_stories.title: Chat’s Womp-Tower Idea
key_stories.summary: During the stream a viewer suggested stacking Womps like construction bricks. Kaze adopted the idea, built the tower, added chain-reaction physics, particles and dialogue, turning it into a comedic set-piece.
key_stories.challenge: Level needed a memorable worker prank.
key_stories.process: Modelled stacked Womps, wrote fall logic, tuned animations and VFX, crafted rude dialogue.
key_stories.outcome: Tower works on emulator and mostly on hardware; now part of five-prank star.
key_stories.key_quote: Sometimes the stream just has a really funny idea – this tower is so funny.

key_stories.title: The Composer Returns
key_stories.summary: Composer Badub had been silent; he contacted Kaze saying he is composing again and tackling Course 11’s music.
key_stories.challenge: Placeholder AI music lacked character; project needed original soundtrack.
key_stories.process: Badub spent a week creating ten drafts; communicates progress via messages.
key_stories.outcome: Custom track in progress; placeholder remains until delivery.
key_stories.key_quote: He’s back and he’s making music again… really putting in the effort.

key_stories.title: Fighting the ROM-Size Ceiling
key_stories.summary: Kaze realised the project is hitting cartridge size limits and began stripping unused assets and resampling audio.
key_stories.challenge: Need space for streamed music without sacrificing performance.
key_stories.process: Deleted Mario 64 background textures, identified oversized 44 kHz samples for down-sampling.
key_stories.outcome: Expects ~0.5 MB gain; will allow big areas to use streamed audio.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re at a point where we have to optimise the game for ROM size.

key_stories.title: Cement-Pit Koopa
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Zeina crafted a Koopa NPC guarding fresh cement that Mario can ruin, triggering angry reactions.
key_stories.challenge: Design a second ‘worker prank’ that teaches players experimentation.
key_stories.process: Added footprints mechanic, angry dialogue, new animations, rotation logic and sound.
key_stories.outcome: NPC functions; still tuning hint text and nose-puff VFX.
key_stories.key_quote: You ruined it! – He’s so angry.
